item.title: Black Ops 6: How to Get the Raven Sword and Solve the Code in Citadelle des Morts
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Step 1: Acquire the Raven Bastard Sword
  • Step 2: Find the Antiquity in the Alchemical Lab
  • Step 3: Solve the Raven Sword Code Puzzle
  • Step 4: Guide the Orbs into the Shadow Rifts
  • Step 5: Interact with the Raven Puzzle to Obtain Balmung
  • Is the Balmung Raven Sword Good?

One of the most popular choices for the swords in Citadelle des Morts is Balmung, also known as the Raven Sword. This mighty Black Ops 6 Wonder Weapon definitely has its advantages, but how can players exactly get their hands on this sharp and pointy melee weapon that makes hacking and slashing the undead hordes so fun?

The Balmung Sword is arguably the most complex of the 4 Swords in Black Ops 6 ’s Citadelle des Morts, but this guide will make it beyond easy for players to claim the Sword in their own rounds of the map thanks to an easy translation of the Raven Sword code and all solutions.

Step 1: Acquire the Raven Bastard Sword

Players can get their hands on the Raven Bastard Sword by acquiring a Stamp, heading into the Dining Hall by Vulture Aid, and then interacting with the knight statue on the far left. This knight statue is indicated by the stone raven perched on its shoulder, as well as the dragon graffiti behind it. Once players interact with this statue, it will gift players the Raven Bastard Sword that players can equip as their dedicated melee weapon.

Step 2: Find the Antiquity in the Alchemical Lab

With the Raven Bastard Sword now claimed, head into the Alchemical Lab where players must begin their hunt for their specific Antiquity. If players do not have access to the Alchemical Lab, then they simply need to turn on Pack-a-Punch, as the Alchemical Lab is a secret room between the Sitting Rooms (Stamin-Up) and the Dining Hall (Vulture Aid).

Inside the Alchemical Lab, players are looking for a specific item that will be lurking on one of the shelves or desks. The spawn is random, as is the item, so players should scour the Alchemical Lab in search of one of these items:

  • Horn
  • Jaw Bone
  • Fish Fossil (Rock)
  • Scorpion Fossil (Rock)
  • Bird Skulls

Once players find one of these items, they must then pick it up to proceed with the next step.

Step 3: Solve the Raven Sword Code Puzzle

Players need to bring the Antiquity that they have into the Tavern Cellar. The Tavern can be found in the Town Square (spawn area), or simply by paying 500 Essence to fast travel here from the Pack-a-Punch room. Once inside, the South wall between a Crafting Bench and a zombie spawn hole will have a metal dial. Players will want to interact with this dial to place the Antiquity, and then interact with it again to place the Raven Bastard Sword.

Players can now interact with the Raven Sword puzzle dial, where they have the option to rotate the inner ring with L1 and rotate the outer ring with R1. The objective here is to match the bone fragment that players have with the corresponding Astrology symbol and element using the bottom symbols (closest symbols to the sword). There are only five answers, so here are all the Raven Sword codes, explained:

Antiquity

Inner Symbol

Outer Symbol

Horn

Fire (Triangle)

Aries

Raven Skulls

Air (Triangle with a line)

Gemini

Jaw

Fire (Triangle)

Leo

Scorpion

Water (Upside-Down Triangle)

Scorpio

Fish

Water (Upside-Down Triangle)

Pisces

Once players have aligned the symbols with their Antiquity, hit the Circle/B to submit the answer. If done correctly, music will begin to play and void orbs will sprout from the ground. If done incorrectly, players will need to try again next round.

Step 4: Guide the Orbs into the Shadow Rifts

Now that players have solved the Raven Sword puzzle, purple orbs will slowly begin to follow the player. These orbs can deal a bit of damage, so try to avoid them, but do remember that the objective is to guide them into a void tear that appears in the Tavern. Three orbs must reach the same void tear, and this must be repeated a total of three times.

The first void tear is located in the Tavern Cellar, where just opposite the Crafting Bench, players must make the shadow orbs follow them so that they get sucked into the hole.

The second void tear is located in the Tavern’s first floor, just beside the main doors. Lead these purple orbs into the hole by committing to a slow train like one would do a zombie horde.

The second void tear is found in the Tavern’s second floor just by the dart table and the pool table. Run around the pool table or take the stairs to manipulate the shadow orbs into following.

Step 5: Interact with the Raven Puzzle to Obtain Balmung

The last step concludes with the shadow rifts and shadow orbs step, and all players need to do after finishing the third shadow tear in the Tavern is head back down to the Tavern Cellar where they will be able to interact with the Raven Puzzle Cylinder. Doing so will see the sword sucked into the void, only to emerge seconds later dripping with dark magic. Players can now pick up the Balmung Raven Sword.

If players want to return to Balmung, then they just need to head into the Dining Hall and interact with the Raven Knight statue again, which will see the knight cusp the sword and wait for someone else to claim it again.

Is the Balmung Raven Sword Good?

Balmung is a great upgraded Sword to have in Citadelle des Morts due to its situational activity. Balmung uses the same effects as a Shadow Rift Ammo Mod, so each slash has a random chance to teleport zombies into the sky so that they fall to their deaths. Yet, perhaps the most intriguing of the Balmung’s abilities is its Special Attack, which will see players tear a rift into a dark dimension where zombies will be sucked in and killed, much like a mini-LT53 Kazimir Tactical Equipment.

item.title: Like A Dragon: 8 Best Female Characters In The Series
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Yakuza games feature memorable characters with deep story arcs and emotional moments for players to enjoy.
  • Recent games aim to improve female representation, showcasing well-developed and engaging female characters.
  • The Yakuza series is praised for blending serious storytelling with goofy side content, creating a unique and cohesive gaming experience.

Like a Dragon is a franchise that is churning out hit after hit, with fans being treated to numerous games that boast either turn-based or real-time combat. The stories of these titles are told with great seriousness, which may seem at odds with the goofy nature of the side content only for players to see how well both halves of a Yakuza game mesh with each other.

Every Yakuza game features its fair share of memorable characters who are a joy to interact with. Female representation in the series hasn't been the greatest, but recent games have tried to turn things around in this department.

Warning! Spoilers Ahead!

1 Reina

The Proprietor Of Serena Who Tries To Make Amends For Her Betrayal

  • Appears In: Yakuza 0 , Yakuza/Yakuza Kiwami

A woman who owned Serena and had a close connection to both Kiryu and Nishiki, it's heartbreaking to see the trajectory Reina's character takes in the series. She genuinely goes out of her way to help Kiryu out in the first game, only for her feelings for Nishikiyama to lead her down a dark path.

She betrays Kiryu by serving as an informer, only to have a change of heart as she tries to make amends. Unfortunately, she becomes a casualty of the confrontation between the two friends, with the sight of her body causing Kiryu to channel his rage and beat her murderer within an inch of his life.

2 Yuki

Club Sunshine's Star Hostess

  • Appears In: Yakuza 0 , Yakuza Kiwami 2 , Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth

The Cabaret Club Czar minigame in Yakuza 0 is arguably the greatest side activity in the series fans can get invested in. There's something magical about satisfying guests by assigning appropriate hostesses and turning Club Sunshine into the best cabaret club in Sotenbori.

The first Platinum Hostess that players start with is Yuki, who may seem ditzy at first glance only to grow and become the best hostess in the club. Her naivety and muted charm make her one of the best characters in Yakuza 0 that players will love to interact with, even if she may be treated somewhat dismissively at times.

3 Yumi Sawamura

A Series Of Events Involving This Former Hostess Lead To Kiryu's Imprisonment

  • Appears In: Yakuza/Yakuza Kiwami

Yumi and Kiryu could've been a thing if their stories had gone down a different route. Unfortunately, Sohei Dojima's horrible actions caused a string of events that led to Kiryu taking his friend's place and going to prison.

Kiryu's search for Yumi following his release from prison felt hopeless until he finally got in touch with a woman who'd lost her memories. Before they could reunite, Yumi sacrificed herself and took a bullet meant for Kiryu and Haruka. After saving the man he loved and her daughter, she breathed her last in an emotional finale.

4 Kaoru Sayama

A Detective Who Crosses Paths With Kiryu More Than Once

  • Appears In: Yakuza 2/Yakuza Kiwami 2 , Yakuza 3 , Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth

Kaoru is an intriguing character who investigates a case that puts her at odds with Kiryu more often than not. However, as the two characters eventually settle their differences, it's clear that they both have feelings for each other, culminating in a kiss moments before a bomb is supposed to explode.

Thankfully, the duo survives at the very last second, as revealed in the epilogue where the duo visit the graves of their fallen comrades. It's a shame that Yakuza 3 decided not to move ahead with this romance and shelved this character until a fateful appearance in Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth .

5 Makoto Makimura

The Unwitting Owner Of The Empty Lot Who Becomes A Target For The Yakuza

  • Appears In: Yakuza 0 , Yakuza Kiwami 2

Makoto Makimura is one of the most intriguing characters in Yakuza 0 , having gone through hell and back before Majima even encounters her. The gangster had been passive for a long time, but he decided to play the hero once in his life and save Makoto from the people who were hunting her.

It's hard not to feel for a character who can't catch a break in life, reaching a point where she risked her life in a gamble near the end of Yakuza 0 . Her character plays a huge role in transforming a meek Majima into the Mad Dog of Shimano, and fans were glad to get some closure in Yakuza Kiwami 2 when they got the chance to control Majima.

6 Seonhee

The Leader Of The Geomijul

  • Appears In: Yakuza: Like a Dragon , Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth

Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth wastes no time in turning Isezaki Ijincho into one of the best open-world hubs in the Yakuza series. This district is jam-packed with gang warfare, with the Geomijul playing a major role as information brokers behind the scenes.

The leader of this group is Seonhee, a femme fatale who wastes no time in establishing herself as one of the best characters in the Yakuza series. Players were glad to find out that they could control this dynamic character in Infinite Wealth .

7 Saeko Mukoda

Makes A Bombastic Entry As The Franchise Shifts Genres

  • Appears In: Yakuza: Like a Dragon , Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name , Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth

The sister of Nanoha Mukoda who appears at Nonomiya's funeral, Saeko is a badass character who feels right at home with the predominantly male cast of Yakuza: Like a Dragon . She's a unique character with access to a whole host of unique jobs that make her a blast to control.

It helps that Saeko is a well-written character, and fans will love to help her out as she tries to help her sister without making her efforts too obvious. Experiencing the story of both Like a Dragon and Infinite Wealth with her accompanying Ichiban helps the story stand out even more.

8 Haruka Sawamura

Kiryu's Adoptive Daughter Who Goes Through A Notable Character Arc Across Multiple Yakuza Games

  • Appears In: Yakuza/Yakuza Kiwami , Yakuza 2/Yakuza Kiwami 2 , Yakuza 3 , Yakuza 4 , Yakuza: Dead Souls , Yakuza 5 , Yakuza 6 , Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name , Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth

It would be impossible to talk about the best female characters in Like a Dragon without mentioning the only one players can control. Haruka has faced a turbulent childhood, but Kiryu helps serve as a father figure in her life as she matures into a wise and self-sufficient person.

It's a testament to how engaging Yakuza 5 is that the segment where players control her ends up being one of the best parts of the series despite lacking any kind of combat whatsoever. Instead, players engage in dance battles and help her become a successful idol.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: How To Respec Passive Skill Points
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Respecing In Path of Exile 2
  • How To Refund Passive Skill Points In Path of Exile 2

Every time you level up in Path of Exile 2 ; you'll earn a Passive Skill point that can be put in an ever-expanding skill tree to strengthen various stats of your character. While skill gems are used to unlock new skills and level them up, passive skills will be the foundation for your build along with the support gems you also use.

While just about any passive skill is useful in some way, focusing on the right ones over time will see very different builds even if your weapons and skills are the same. Should you use a few passive skills points you now regret, they can later be refunded to be spent again; here's how to do it.

How To Unlock Respecing In Path of Exile 2

You won't be able to respec right at the beginning of the game but don't restart if you want to use the same class, because it can be unlocked with only a few hours of playtime depending on if you focus on the main missions. To unlock respecing you'll need to complete the following quests:

  • Reaching Clearfell
  • Treacherous Ground
  • Secrets In The Dark
  • Sorrow Among Stones
  • The Mysterious Shade

At the end of The Mysterious Shade , recommended around level 8 with rare items, The Hooded One will be brought back to full strength and will stay in town, now also being the location where you can refund passive skill points.

How To Refund Passive Skill Points In Path of Exile 2

To refund passive skill points and respec, talk to The Hooded One in town and select the option, "Refund Passives" . This will open up your passives skill tree and let you select which passive skills you want to refund, with a gold cost depending on how many you wish you refund. You're only able to refund the latest passives in the tree, so you'll have to work backward if you want to refund an earlier skill.

You can refund as many or as few skills as you'd like at once, with no limitation on when or how often you can refund moving forward .

Once these points have been refunded, they will be back in the same passive skill tree menu as if you just leveled up, letting you pick whatever skills you want. Each class can use many different weapons, such as the Mercenary's Crossbow, and switching your passives with a new weapon is recommended since they all come with different skills and play styles.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: All Class Ascendancies (& Ascendancy Nodes)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • PoE 2 Mercenary Ascensions
  • PoE 2 Monk Ascensions
  • PoE 2 Ranger Ascensions
  • PoE 2 Sorceress Ascensions
  • PoE 2 Warrior Ascensions
  • PoE 2 Witch Ascensions

In Path of Exile , each class gains power through Skill Gems, equipment, and several skill trees that intertwine to empower the player. The series' iconic (and enormous) Passive Skill Tree returns alongside another mainstay of the original Path of Exile : Ascendancy classes. These PoE 2 Ascendancy classes upon each base class by offering dramatically powerful or useful abilities through Ascendancy Nodes.

As of the Early Access release of Path of Exile 2 , Ascendancy is limited to two per class – and on launch, there were six classes. This makes for a huge variety of class Ascendancies Path of Exile 2 players can build towards, each of which offers completely different gameplay with unique Ascendancy nodes that grant game-changing Passive and Active abilities as well as mechanics wholly unique to each Ascendancy.

This list of all Path of Exile 2 class Ascendancies will be updated throughout the PoE 2 Early Access as more classes and Ascendancy classes are added to the game.

PoE 2 Mercenary Ascensions

Gemling Legionnaire

Notable Nodes

Effects

Crystalline Potential

  • +10% to Quality of all Skills

Implanted Gems

  • +1 to Level of all Skills

Advanced Thaumaturgy

  • 30% less Cost for all Skills
  • Skill Gems gain 30% more Attribute Requirements

Integrated Efficiency

  • Grants +3 Skill Points

Gem Studded

  • You can use two copies of the same Support Gem in two different Skills

Thaumaturgical Infusion

  • +1% to Max Cold Resist for every 4 Blue Support Gems socketed
  • +1% to Max Fire Resist for every 4 Blue Support Gems socketed
  • +1% to Max Lightning Resist for every 4 Blue Support Gems socketed

Adaptive Capability

  • Attribute Requirements for Gems can be satisfied by your highest Attribute

Enhanced Effectiveness

  • Inherent bonuses from Intelligence, Strength, and Dexterity are doubled

Witchhunter

Notable Nodes

Effects

Weapon Master

  • 20 Passive Skill Points become Weapon Set Skill Points

Pitiless Killer

  • Grants the Culling Strike ability

Judge, Jury, and Executioner

  • Grants the Decimating Strike ability

Witchbane

  • Unlocks the Concentration mechanic
    • Enemies have Max Concentration equal to 40% Max Life
    • Enemy Concentration depletes at a rate of 100% Damage Dealt, lowering Cooldown recovery
    • Enemies gain Concentration back over time after 5 seconds

No Mercy

  • Deal up to 30% more Damage to enemies based on their missing Concentration

Obsessive Rituals

  • Grants Sorcery Ward, but reduces Armor and Evasion by 50%

Ceremonial Ablution

  • Empowers Sorcery Ward by 50% and reduces Sorcery Ward recovery time by 50%

Zealous Inquisition

  • 10% chance for enemies you kill to Explode, dealing their Max Life as damage
  • Chance doubled against Undead and Demons

PoE 2 Monk Ascensions

Acolyte of Chayula

Notable Nodes

Effects

Ravenous Doubts

  • Mana Leech becomes an Instant skill

Consuming Questions

  • Mana Leech also recovers Energy Shield, but it does not recharge normally

Chayula's Gift

  • +10% Max Chaos Resistance
  • Doubles Chaos Resistance

Reality Rending

  • 23% chance to gain 25% extra Chaos Damage with hits
  • 13% chance to gain 50% extra Chaos Damage with hits
  • 7% chance to gain 100% extra Chaos Damage with hits

Waking Dream

  • Grants the Into The Breach skill, granting Breach status in non-Breach zones

Lucid Dreaming

  • Flames of Chayula duration is doubled

Embrace the Darkness

  • Replaces Spirit with Darkness, which is Reserved at a 1:1 ratio instead of taking damage to your Life (if possible)

Grasp of the Void

  • Gain 1% damage as extra Chaos Damage for every 20 Unreserved Darkness

Inner Silence

  • Darkness Reservation duration reduced by 50%

Invoker

Notable Nodes

Effects

Lead me through Grace...

  • Gain 1 Spirit for every 6 Energy Shield on Body Armor
  • Gain 1 Spirit for every 15 Evasion on Body Armor
  • Removes ability to gain Spirit from Equipment normally

...and Protect me from Harm

  • Evasion also grants Physical Damage Reduction
  • Reduces Evasion by 40%

Faith is a Choice

  • Grants the Meditate skill, allowing you to overcharge your Energy Shield for double its normal maximum

I am the Blizzard...

  • Gain extra 10% of damage as Cold Damage
  • Create Freezing Ground when attacking Freezing enemies

...and I Shall Rage

  • Grants the Unbound Avatar skill, allowing you to become temporarily massively empowered

The Soul Springs Eternal

  • Gain 35% more Energy from Meta Skills

Sunder my Enemies...

  • Critical Hits ignore non-negative enemy Elemental Resistances

...and Scatter Them to the Winds

  • Grants the Elemental Expression skill, which triggers a massive elemental explosion with melee Critical Hits

PoE 2 Ranger Ascensions

Deadeye

Notable Nodes

Effects

Avidity

  • 30% chance that if you gain Frenzy Charges, you instead gain up to your maximum number of Frenzy Charges

Thrilling Chase

  • Benefits from consuming Frenzy Charges for your skills have 5a 0% chance to be doubled

Eagle Eyes

  • You have no Accuracy Penalty while at a distance

Specialization: Far Shot

  • Projectiles deal more damage after traveling for 3.5 m, scaling up to 20% after 7m

Specialization: Point Blank

  • Projectiles deal up to 20% more damage before traveling for 3.5m, scaling down to 0% bonus to enemies beyond 7m

Endless Munitions

  • Skills fire an additional Projectile

Called Shots

  • You can apply an additional Mark

Gathering Winds

  • Gain Tailwind on Skill use, which stacks to grant increased Movement/Skill Speed, but lose all stacks upon being hit

Wind Ward

  • Take 3% less damage per Tailwind stack

Pathfinder

Notable Nodes

Effects

Connected Chemistry

  • 50% more Flask Charges gained

Enduring Elixirs

  • Life Flask Effects are not removed when Unreserved Life is Filled
  • Life Flask Effects do not Queue

Contagious Contamination

  • The most Damaging Poison on Enemies you Kill is Spread to other Enemies within 1.5 meters

Overwhelming Toxicity

  • Double the number of Poisons you can inflict on Enemies
  • 35% less Poison Duration

Brew Concoction

  • Grants the Ranger the ability to brew one of five concoctions, which use Mana Flask charges to create thrown weapons
    • Poisonous Concoction: Chaos damage & Poison effect
    • Fulminating Concoction: Lightning damage & Lightning Exposure
    • Shattering Concoction: Cold damage & Cold Exposure
    • Explosive Concoction: Explosive/Fire damage & Fire Exposure
    • Bleeding Concoction: Physical damage & Bleed effect

Traveller's Wisdom

  • Grants 5 Passive Skill Points

Running Assault

  • 30% less Movement Speed Penalty when using Skills while moving

Relentless Pursuit

  • Your speed is unaffected by Slows

PoE 2 Sorceress Ascensions

Chronomancer

Notable Nodes

Effects

Now and Again

  • All Skills have a 33% chance to not consume a Cooldown when used

Unbound Encore

  • Grants the Time Snap skill, which resets the cooldown of other Skills

Ultimate Command

  • Grants the Time Freeze skill, which freeze all enemies in place in a large area

Footprints in the Sand

  • Grants the Temporal Rift skill, which lets you return to a prior location with the Life and Mana you had at the time

Quicksand Hourglass

  • Every 12 sec, gain 50% bonus Cast Speed for 4 sec

Apex of the Moment

  • Enemies in your nearby Presence are Slowed by 20%

Circular Heartbeat

  • 30% of all damage taken Recouped as Life

The Rapid River

  • Recoup Effects instead occur over 4 sec

Stormweaver

Notable Nodes

Effects

Scouring Winds

  • All elemental Exposure you inflict lowers the affected Resistance by an additional 20%

Tempest Caller

  • Grants the Elemental Storm skill, which lets you create a storm on a location that deals Elemental damage
  • Trigger Elemental Storm on Critical Hits with all Spells

Rain Dancer

  • Elemental Storm has a 150% faster Cooldown recovery rate

Heavy Snows

  • Targets can be affected by your Chills at the same time
  • Your Chills can reduce all affected enemy Action Speed by up to 35%
  • 25% less Magnitude of Chill when inflicted

Shaper of Water

  • All Damage from Hits Contributes to Chill Magnitude

Strike Twice

  • Targets can be affected by two of your Shocks at the same time
  • 50% less Shock effect duration

Shaper of Storms

  • All Damage from all Hits contributes to Shock Chance

Constant Gale

  • Grants the Arcane Surge ability, increasing Cast Speed and Mana Regeneration

Force of Will

  • 1% increased effect of Arcane Surge for every 15 maximum Mana

Heart of the Storm

  • 40% of Elemental Damage taken is Recouped in your Energy Shield

PoE 2 Warrior Ascensions

Titan

Notable Nodes

Effects

Stone Skin

  • 50% more Armor from equipped Body Armour

Earthbreaker

  • 20% chance for Slam Skills you use yourself to cause Aftershocks

Ancestral Empowerment

  • Every second Slam Skill you use yourself is Ancestrally Boosted

Colossal Capacity

  • Carry a chest which adds 20 Inventory slots

Hulking Form

  • 50% increased effect of small Passive Skill Tree skills

Crushing Impacts

  • All Hits become Crushing Blows

Surprising Strength

  • 40% boosted Damage against Heavy Stunned enemies

Mysterious Lineage

  • 15% boost to Maximum Life

Warbringer

Notable Nodes

Effects

Anvil's Weight

  • Break Armor equal to 10% of Hit damage dealt

Imploding Impacts

  • Enemy Armor can be broken below 0, increasing damage taken

Jade Heritage

  • Grants the Encase in Jade skill, protecting the player from all damage but completely restricting movement

Answered Call

  • Grants the Ancestral Spirits skill, summoning an Ancestral Spirit minion whenever you summon a Totem
  • If the Totem is destroyed, the minion is de-spawned

Wooden Wall

  • 20% of damage from Hits is taken from your nearest Totem's Life before your own Life

Renly's Training

  • Gain 40% of your base chance to Block from equipped Shields instead of the Shield's intrinsic value

Turtle Charm

  • Reduce Block Chance by 35%, but you can Block without a Shield raised

Warcaller's Bellow

  • Corpses in your Presence Explode when you use a Warcry, dealing 25% of their Max Life as Physical damage

Greatwolf's Howl

  • Completely remove all Warcry cooldowns

PoE 2 Witch Ascensions

Blood Mage

Notable Nodes

Effects

Sanguimancy

  • Grants the Life Remnants skill, allowing you to restore Life from enemies and spawn Life Remnants
  • Life Remnants restore Life and can Overflow your Max Life total

Vitality Siphon

  • Leech 10% of Spell Damage as Life

Open Sores

  • Your Curses have an infinite duration

Blood Barbs

  • Gain 10% of damage as extra Physical damage
  • Elemental damage also contributes to Bleeding strength

Gore Spike

  • 1% increased Critical Damage Bonus for every 40 Max Life

Sunder the Flesh

  • Base Critical Hit Chance for Spells becomes 15%

Grasping Wounds

  • 25% of Life loss from Hits is instead spread out over 4 sec

Crimson Power

  • Your Body Armor's Energy Shield rating contributes to your Max Life

Infernalist

Notable Nodes

Effects

Altered Flesh

  • 20% of Cold Damage taken as Fire Damage instead
  • 20% of Lightning Damage taken as Fire Damage instead
  • 20% of Physical damage is as Chaos Damage instead

Beidat's Gaze

  • Reserves 25% of Life
  • +1 Max Mana for every 6 Max Life you have

Beidat's Will

  • Reserves 25% of Life
  • +1 to Max Spirit for every 25 Max Life you have

Beidat's Hand

  • Reserves 25% of Life
  • +1 to Max Energy Shield for every 8 Max Life you have

Demonic Possession

  • Grants the Demon Form skill, unlocking the ability to shapeshift into a Demon and empower your spells
  • Depletes over time as you accumulate Demonflame, until your Life reaches 1

Mastered Darkness

  • Max Demonflame increased to 10

Pyromantic Pact

  • Replace Mana with Infernal Flame, and assign an Infernal Flame cost for every Skill that would use Mana
  • Casting Skills builds up your Infernal Flame meter instead of depleting Mana
  • Take devastating damage when Infernal Flame reaches its maximum

Bringer of Flame

  • While not on Low Infernal Flame, all damage from you and Allies in your nearby Presence contributes to Ignite Chance

Seething Body

  • While on High Infernal Flame, you and all nearby Allies in your presence gain 20% of damage as Fire Damage

Loyal Hellhound

  • Grants the ability to summon an Infernal Hound minion, which takes 20% of your incoming damage, ignites enemies, and revives itself

Grinning Immolation

  • Ignite when you deal a Critical Hit, taking 15% Life and Energy Shield as Fire Damage every second, but granting +30% Critical damage

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Get Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to get the Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit in Infinity Nikki
  • Evolving the Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit in Infinity Nikki

Now that Infinity Nikki is officially launched, players will have plenty to do with Nikki and Momo as they explore the world and find the best outfits to dress up and enjoy themselves. The extensive selection of garments is likely going to be the biggest selling point for many players, but obtaining them may not always be an easy task.

The Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit for Nikki is definitely one to look out for, especially as it is an exclusive in-game reward that you do not want to miss out on. If you are hoping to get this ensemble in your wardrobe, this guide will show you just how to do so in Infinity Nikki .

How to get the Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit in Infinity Nikki

As one of the latest dress-up games, Infinity Nikki is marking the occasion by rewarding players for being part of the celebrations. Starting on December 6, the Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit will become available for all players as part of the Heartfelt Wish Event. It will run from December 6 to December 19.

Go to the Events menu by selecting the party popper icon at the top right of the screen, and select the Events app. Here, you will be able to get to the Heartfelt Wish event and claim the following rewards:

  • Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit (4-Star)
  • Surprise Bloom Photo Pose
  • 1206 x Thread of Purity

Here are the full stats of the outfit:

Stat

Base Stats

Max Stats

Elegant

246

1529

Fresh

809

5020

Sweet

1652

10246

Sexy

196

1219

Cool

232

1442

The new outfit is obviously the biggest prize here, but there's more you can do with it after collecting the outfit.

Evolving the Starlit Celebration Birthday Outfit in Infinity Nikki

Like other outfits in the game, this new addition can also be upgraded by using different materials found in Infinity Nikki . This will turn the purple outfit into a blue and yellow one dubbed Happiness. In order to do so, you will need a number of Blings, Threads of Purity, and Calm Thoughts.

This will add another look for Nikki to sport, and give you more options as you continue on your adventure either alone or with friends.
